reviews.review_msg: Taught the 303 lab, incorporated an hour Tutorial for no reason in the week. Labs were alright and well comprehended.
Very approachable
She's really nice and wants you to learn but her tests are HARD. If you're looking to boost your GPA it's not gonna happen with her class.
Super helpful and nice lab instructor.  Exams are tough though.
Very easy & friendly lab instructor

midterm was hella rushed so gotta write fast and work quick. MC, T/F, fill in blank and written on exams. Memorize everything and you can do good. final was a bit weird but if you memorize evrything and understand processes gone over in class you can do good. boring lectures and sometimes confusing so read textbook to clear up concepts. Nice prof.

I maintained an A+ throughout the whole course (including the lab exam) but the final I wrote today definitely ruined that. It felt like a mental marathon with 6 long 6-10 point questions and brutal MC and fill in the blanks. Wouldn't recommend giving yourself the stress unless u absolutely have to.
I always find her class difficult... Heavy reading and hard to figure out where to focus on for exam because there is so much detail. Personally, I wouldn't recommend taking her class.

This is an intense/content heavy class, but Jane guides you in the best way. Her lectures are clear, but she is open to any questions and accessible in her office. The exams are tough, but fair. If she provides you example problems or extra content in the lectures it will show up on the exams!

Great Professor, clear notes and fair exams. Make sure you read the textbook as she stressed many times throughout the course. Exams are not memorization so you really have to understand the material to excel in the course.

I really liked Dr. Guttman, exams were straight forward, no long answer questions, just MC and short answer. He was also very enthusiastic and his lectures were fairly simplistic. Just make sure you study everything from the lecture slides and you will do great!

I think I am paying to learn material I will need in my career.
Guttman thinks I am paying for the right to take exams. 
He makes learning the material as difficult as he can. Lecture slides are posted, shrunk down to half a page, in black and white, with all needed material deleted. 
He could have lectures recorded, but he chose not to
He yells.

It is work heavy course. Two labs a week are exhausting with the pre labs, discussion questions, poster etc. You have to go to labs on non scheduled days to get observations on your experiment. However lectures were good and exams were from slides. Have to go to lecture to pass the course as slides are empty and need to be filled in class.

Very passionate and knowledgeable professor. His lectures are enjoyable but very info dense so you never put your pen down and it's hard to pay attention to what he says in class. Attendance somewhat mandatory as his slides are blank. Some may find his testing very specific and difficult but diligent studying makes it very fair. Highly recommend.

The exams are based on the lectures. The lectures are packed with information that you probably won't be able to properly remember since you will be too busy filling in the blanks he leaves in the lecture slides. He's passionate about the stuff he teaches, which makes it interesting to learn about, but memorizing everything can be painful.

Since it was online, all of his lectures were recorded so he was just reading off the slides and explaining diagrams a bit monotonously. I don't really think his lectures added anything; you could just read slides yourself. I think he's a good dude and might be better in person? Exams are memorization so remember literally everything!

BEST PROFESSOR ANYONE COULD EVER ASK FOR!! If you haven't taken this course, you need to take it ASAP. He's a genuine prof., always there for you when you need help. ALSO, he's an amazing mentor! You the best, Julian, an inspiration to us.
Extremely enthusiastic about the course content, however talks really fast while you're filling in the blanks in your notes. Exams are pure memorization, be sure to study all the little details!

I am a chem major, took this class as an elective. When people say biology is all rote memorization, he definitely further enhances this stereotype.  Nice guy but thinks the "GPA" is all that matters in life. His ideologies seemed kind of silly for 2014.

There is a lot of memorization. His midterm was very fair but the final was quite hard because of the amount of detail he expected you to know even for the very small concepts. I found the course very interesting overall and would recommend this prof.
Exams are one word/ one sentence. Have to know the little specific details. Not able to answer questions in class.

This guy loves memorization and has the worst lecturing style I've come across in my 4 years here. He posts 10% of the notes, and forces you to write down the other 90% while simultaneously explaining it (making the explanation pointless since you're too busy writing). His exams test memorization, not knowledge. He fails to answer questions in clas
He doesn't test your understanding but rather your memorization skills. He shouldn't teach this course. I heard Dr. Moore is much better.
Horrible..

He's ok at explaining but totally bonkers exams. He doesn't ask concepts he just asks for your ability to recall words and meaning. Absolutely horrible final exam, when he says cumulative it's really cumulative. You really should read the book cause on the final there are terms from it that he doesn't cover!

His exams doesn't really test you what you learned in the course. The questions were: filling in the blanks, matching, mc, very high school liked. He likes to ask for unimportant facts. He's nice in lecture but not approachable in office hours.

Great lecturer, explains things well.  He leaves things out of his slides so you have to come to class. His midterm was very easy, but his final was much much more difficult.  He has a whole section asking you to name important people (ie. who discovered which bacteria) so study for that!
Very respectful guy, clear speaker, and helpful. Also, the tests are fair.
Best prof EVER!  He made me love microbiology.  Really hot too!  TAs are awesome as well.
midterm is not hard, but questions are scattered on general stuff, tough marker on little things, watch for syntax in spelling
Very funny guy, clearly into the stuff he teaches. I didn't do so well on the midterm but I admit that it was pretty easy..looking forward to the final!
Great professor.  Lectures are well layed out and flow nicely.  Nice guy and very quick to respond to emails.
Awesome lecturer. Best class ever. I love this class. Exam is not hard at all and he's a fair marker. TAs in this class are extremely helpful too.
good lecturer. helpful outside of class. midterm was hard! hard marker!
Good prof Very demanding course Tests are tough but pretty fair Don't miss lectures

avoid bisc303, it is the most work required for a class i have ever experienced. her exams were very difficult, the final had two essays and was out of 130, all long and short answer. it took me the full 3 hours to wrtie it with not time to double check. lectures are boring and you must study the textbook to know the details she wants

Her lectures may be boring but they are easy to follow. A lot of in-class written notes though. Midterm was hard and tricky but the final was much more fair. Lab assignments takes a BIG chunk out of your week so keep that in mind. If you're good at memorizing small details you'll do fine.

Think about learning bits and pieces of random things about bacteria/fungi/viruses and then having to regurgitate them for your exam.  This course tries to cover way too much about so many broad topics.  Thumbs down.  Budget your time for the MT.  And bring an alarm clock because Margo puts you to sleeeeeep.
Best prof I've had at SFU so far.  Hard marker... make sure you pay attention to samll details.
Awesome prof.  Very clear and enthusiastic.  Only problem was that the exams were too long for the time allotted.  Avoid this class if you can't write FAST.

Peter is great, not sure how he maintained his composure during some labs where everyone continued to ask him the same questions, but he somehow did it. This lab is a TON of work, it is twice a week with many labs that require you to come in the following lab. That being said, it is a fun lab with a lot of opportunity for learning.

He's a well respected professor, but personally I was not a fan of his teaching style. The lectures provided bare bones information, you will have to read textbook for specifics that will be examined. Exams were on the harder side, but still fair. Lots of online reading and quizzes, and 30+ lab reports to do in the class.

Peter is super friendly and very approachable. He teaches the material well and will always answer all your questions. The course isn't necessarily hard but requires a lot of time. Informal lab reports, online quizzes, following up on labs outside of class, doing the unknown project. It's a lot of work so be prepared. Otherwise, recommended!
never pass up this legend

AMAZING!!! Favorite instructor at SFU after 3 years! Goes the extra mile, so HELPFUL and approcable: I asked the same dumb question every lab period and he was nothing but nice every time I asked him! Exams are fair and easy, has "in lecture" quizzes designed to boost ur mark, and is so transparent with marking. FAVORITE course at SFU.
Peter is very helpful. The guy is cool beans
He is just awesome

he is a good prof for lab, but not a good prof for teaching lectures. a lot of typos in his lectures, and he did not fix them after class. His final exam was mostly memorization, and cumulative. I suggest you do not take this course with him if he is the primary prof. he is very good person, but not a perfect prof( he needs more experience)

Awesome prof and very nice guy!!! Really fun and interesting lab. I had a great time and was one of the best labs I've been in. Compared to mbb labs this was a breeze. The lab final was kinda hard though simply becuz it was surprising to find out theres actually alot of material learned! Be prepared to do a load of lab writeups

He is SOOOOO NICE !!!! very easy prof. He let some students take the final exam early cuz they might have vacation plans!!! the course is easy but a lot of informal reports to write. ONly one formal report. Very easy to do if u've taken any mbb lab courses. A lot of dilution calculations but very easy!!! It was a FUN course and lab lab was easy
Great prof! sometimes, his lectures are pretty interesting. I enjoyed taking this course with him.
EXCELLENT
nice, super helpful, even ur question is just for ur own interest, he will still help u try to find out the answer if he dunno.
